game

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameManager

  • public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages and tracks the game.
    Author:
    Sean Lewis

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_LEVELS
      Default location for the level files to be located.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameManager()
      Initializes a new GameManager with default levels.
      GameManager(int numRandLevels)
      Initializes a new GameManager that will use random levels.
      GameManager(java.lang.String levelsFile)
      Initializes a new GameManager from a given levels file.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Returns the current level for the game.

      Returns the total number of swings taken in the current level.

      Returns the solution set for the current level.

      Returns the current level number.

      Returns the number of swings taken in a specific level number.

      Returns, excluding the menu level, the number of levels in the game.

      Returns the total number of swings taken in the game.

      Returns if the game has been finished yet.

      Loads a file into the game.
      boolean nextLevel()
      Loads the next level into the memory.
      void save(java.lang.String fileName)
      Saves the game state to a file.

      Tells the GameManager a swing has been taken by the player.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_LEVELS

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_LEVELS
        Default location for the level files to be located.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameManager

        public GameManager()
        Initializes a new GameManager with default levels.

      • GameManager

        public GameManager(java.lang.String levelsFile)
        Initializes a new GameManager from a given levels file.
        Parameters:
        levelsFile - the text file the levels are defined in

      • GameManager

        public GameManager(int numRandLevels)
        Initializes a new GameManager that will use random levels.
        Parameters:
        numRandLevels - the number of random levels the game will have

    • Method Detail

      • getLevelNumber

        public int getLevelNumber()
        Returns the current level number. The menu level is defined as level 0, and the first level is defined as level 1.
        Returns:
        the current level number

      • getNumberOfLevels

        public int getNumberOfLevels()
        Returns, excluding the menu level, the number of levels in the game.
        Returns:
        the number of levels

      • getTotalSwings

        public int getTotalSwings()
        Returns the total number of swings taken in the game.
        Returns:
        total swings taken

      • getCurrentLevelSwings

        public int getCurrentLevelSwings()
        Returns the total number of swings taken in the current level. -1 is returned if there is no current level.
        Returns:
        swings taken in this level

      • getLevelSwings

        public int getLevelSwings(int levelNumber)
        Returns the number of swings taken in a specific level number.
        Parameters:
        levelNumber - a parameter
        Returns:
        number of swings taken in a level

      • getCurrentLevel

        public Level getCurrentLevel()
        Returns the current level for the game.
        Returns:
        the current game level

      • getCurrentSolutions

        public java.util.Collection<java.awt.Point> getCurrentSolutions()
        Returns the solution set for the current level. If the data has not been computed, an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        the current level's solution set, if computed already

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns if the game has been finished yet.
        Returns:
        if the game is over

      • nextLevel

        public boolean nextLevel()
        Loads the next level into the memory.
        Returns:
        true if the next level was loaded, false is no more levels exist.

      • swingTaken

        public void swingTaken()
        Tells the GameManager a swing has been taken by the player. Updates swing information.

      • loadSave

        public static GameManager loadSave(java.io.File fileName)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a file into the game.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file to read from
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the game state to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name to save to
